creditline: Gift of Professor Alfred Moir in memory of Louis Nippert Zelle
description: Seated man playing a lyre, with various animals and birds seated and perched on branches around him; inscriptions at top and bottom; mounted to ivory sheet with grey and gold borders
marks: Inscribed bottom center in pen and brown ink: \"Orp
medium: Pen and brown ink on white laid paper
provenance:
Unidentified collection (L 474, formerly thought to be the mark of P. Crozat);
Private Collection, New Zealand (Sale, Christie's, London, July 4, 1972, lot 67 [group lot], to Baskett and Day, 420 gns); [Baskett and Day, London, since 1972]; [Jean-Luc Baroni, London, in 1980, sold to Moir]; Prof. Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara, CA, 1980-2003, gave to MIA
title: Orpheus Charming the Beasts
